FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
r training guide, records and tabulation; Annual Calendar Year Tabulation "Training", Topographic Maps covering Elizabeth, Orange, Weehawken, and Jersey City, NJ; Site Plant; 

?    Mechanical Integrity program, which includes our preventative maintenance procedures and records; Annual Tabulation of EHS Equipment; 

?    Audit Procedures and Reports which includes our risk management checklist and program.

Our emergency response policies are documented in the Standard Operating Procedures and reviewed with the employees annually.  They include, location of the company's Emergency Response Plan, a general site plan indicating the locations of Extraordinarily Hazardous Substances, Material Safety Data Sheets, location of atmospheric monitoring equipment, location of two way radio equipment, location of portable battery powered lanterns, location of emergency event log book, available equipment such as leak kits and heavy machinery and location of first aid kits, training provided to all employees and frequency of emergency response drills.

There are employees trained in emergency response.  They have periodic drills and assessments of how to mitigate and stop a chlorine release on site, chlorine release off site, sodium and potassium hydroxide solution spills, sodium hypochlorite solution spills, fires and explosions.

The general accidental release prevention program includes routine maintenance checks of equipment, containment vessels and safety measures that are in place.

There has been one accidents in the last five years requiring reporting in the five-year accident history.

We have commissioned the Brine to Bleach plant (Gaseous chlorine process) which has reduced the throughput of bulk chlorine significantly.
